--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Soulstice Omega" <thecode@p...> wrote:
> OOC: Go ahead and try to bust in my kneecaps. You'll break your 
hand on the computer screen, though. The truth is, my Chivtrons would 
be outnumbered and picked off one by one. Fact is, Sarge has no 
fighting skills, Zeni has no fighting skills, Perplex has no fighting 
skills, and that leaves Arrow and Burning Hammer. Burning Hammer is 
totally confused, and Arrow is too protective of his kid. The battle 
between my characters to the death would no doubt, if I played 
fairly, leave at least one dead of my Chosen mafia or Maximals, but 
all of my Chivtrons would fall. You, Legendary Nemesis (you spelled 
it wrong!) are outrageous and absurd!...
> 
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: Legendarynemasis@a... 
>   To: nbwrpg@y... 
>   Sent: Saturday, June 30, 2001 10:36 PM
>   Subject: Re: Dear owners of the Cybers...
> 
> 
>   OOC: ::Busts souls kneecaps in for Rauq since he hasnt posted 
yet:: 
>   Keep it IC, you act like your chivtrons wouldnt have a chance. 
When 
>   you control chars in seperate factions and they get into a fight 
with 
>   each other you have to play them how you would play them if they 
were 
>   fighting a seperate faction. Just because your chars hate each 
other 
>   doesnt mean you have to kill the chars of one faction off. Thats 
just 
>   plain dumb its like saying "Oh, I like this faction so all these 
guys 
>   have to die now because I cant handle them attacking each other." 
>   Look at Yan, he has the alliance against the Maximals, he doesnt 
go 
>   around killing his alliance chars and maximal chars simply 
because 
>   they cant or wont coexist. ou should try to do the same.
>

>   > OOC: Okay, I'm sorry, but it's the truth. My characters could 
not 
>   co-exist in the same faction like that, ad then what? Make them 
act

>   attack the Chivtrons, and then  who would I have die? As much as 
I 
>   like them, my Chivtrons would end up dying. It's not a threat,

you 
>   took it as a threat...

threats
